definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: When the markets opened the following Monday, the Dow bid adieu to 10000 for good.
sentences.chinese: 股市在紧接着的周一开盘时就告别了10000点。

sentences.english: Please telex your offer for 1000 Products B.
sentences.chinese: 请电传产品B一千的开盘价。

sentences.english: Mining and oil stocks moved lower, especially in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦股市方面，矿业和石油个股开盘走低。
东京股市将于今日重新开盘。

sentences.english: NEW YORK (AP) -- New signs of surging corporate profits led to early gains in the stock market Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 美股周二开盘走高，企业利润出现增长的新迹象。

sentences.english: Asian shares were mixed while U. S. stock futures were pointing to mild gains on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲股市涨跌互现，美国股指期货开盘后小幅走高。

sentences.english: The stocks coming in not long after afternoon opening, could get out of the position at high points.
sentences.chinese: 今天午盘开盘不久杀入的，明天在高点就可以出仓了。

sentences.english: Japan's market was closed for a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 日本股市因为法定节假日，今天没有开盘。

sentences.english: The open should act as one extreme of this range.
sentences.chinese: 开盘价应该作为当日振幅范围的一端。

sentences.english: Asian shares lost ground while U.S. stock futures were pointing to a steady open on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲股市纷纷失守，美国股指期货开盘走稳。

sentences.english: In early trading in Tokyo, the dollar fell sharply against the yen.
sentences.chinese: 在东京市场早市开盘时，美元对日元的比价急剧下跌。

sentences.english: I probably should have had it being the, starting here, right, the opening price.
sentences.chinese: 我可能应该从这里进行赋值，也就是开盘价格。

sentences.english: The market opened in a bullish mood.
Said its "decline" First, the index, two new low-priced market price.
sentences.chinese: 其所言的“降”一是指数，二是新开盘低价入市。

sentences.english: The Shanghai Composite Index jumped after opening, but despite suffering some fluctuations reached near 3100 points during trading.
sentences.chinese: 沪指开盘后震荡上攻，盘中一度逼近3100点大关。

sentences.english: World stocks reached a four-year low at the start of trading in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 世界股市在欧洲开盘交易时达到了四年最低点。

definition: (of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
slab/(geology) tectonic plate/(fig.) sector (of the stock market or of industry)/(economic) bloc
